definition: Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]

sentences.english: Office of National Development and Reform Commission …
sentences.chinese: 改革委資環司鄭重聲明。

sentences.english: Hereby I would sincerely recommend this highly-talented student to your institution.
sentences.chinese: 在此我鄭重的向貴校推薦這位才華出衆的學生。

sentences.english: 'Protestations' that the company isn't affiliated with the Chinese military aren't enough, he said.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅鄭重聲明公司和中國軍方沒有聯繫還不夠。

sentences.english: We have a solemn duty to pray, AND make ourselves heard.
sentences.chinese: 我們要爲此鄭重祈禱，併發出自己的聲音。

sentences.english: Yes, and I hope to engage you to be serious likewise.
sentences.chinese: 是呀，我希望你也能夠鄭重其事。

sentences.english: Madame Merle appeared to note this eagerness.
sentences.chinese: 梅爾夫人注意到了這種鄭重其事的臉色。

sentences.english: Take seriously your Covenant of Love with God.
sentences.chinese: 鄭重對待你與天主訂立的愛的盟約。

sentences.english: This world noon, small east formally of warning that beautiful person.
sentences.chinese: 這天下午，小東鄭重的警告了那位麗人。

sentences.english: I formally invite you to be my dancing partner.
sentences.chinese: 鄭重地邀請你當我的舞伴兒。

sentences.english: Chen Yilong wants to transfer into gumshoe team, meet with captain is earnest boycott.
sentences.chinese: 陳一龍想調入刑警隊，遭隊長鄭重抵制。

sentences.english: He explains solemnly that the business is all about helping people.
sentences.chinese: 他鄭重地聲稱，這項事業是爲了幫助人們。

sentences.english: We highly recommend this product for your company.
sentences.chinese: 我們鄭重地推薦這個產品給貴公司。

sentences.english: But Manche assures him, “Now you owe me.”
sentences.chinese: Manche鄭重向他宣告，“現在是你欠我情了。”

sentences.english: Professor Hsiao highly recommended this book and provided detailed annotation on its organization and style.
sentences.chinese: 蕭先生鄭重推介此書，且逐詞評說其章法體例。

sentences.english: My dear aunt, this is being serious indeed.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的舅母，你真是鄭重其事。

sentences.english: "It's a Christmas decoration," my daughter announced.
sentences.chinese: “那是聖誕節的裝飾，”我女兒鄭重其事地說道。

definition: to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
